summary: The Protect and Serve Act of 2025 amends Title 18 of the United States Code to punish crimes targeting law enforcement officers. It introduces a new section, 120, that outlines penalties for individuals who intentionally cause serious bodily injury to law enforcement officers based on their status, or attempt to do so. The bill specifies circumstances that trigger federal jurisdiction and includes certification requirements from the Attorney General before federal prosecution. It defines "law enforcement officer" and clarifies relevant terms.
